result.execSummary:
The defendant William K Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William K Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per Agent Deb Duel defendant has paid all court obligations and restitution in full.
43
Warrant letter sent to the defendant - respond on or before June 29, 2017 or warrant will be issued.

1:26 p.m.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Agent Deb Duel present in court.  Statement by Agent Duel - defendant did make a payment and will extend for 6 months.  Court authorizes a warrant and stays it to the end of next Friday and warrant will be issued on June 30th.  

Court adjourned at 1:28 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:31 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation.  State concurs.  Atty privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $3,549.00
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:37 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:11 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - was just handed an offer and need to review with the defendant.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on July 12, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:12 a.m.
Status hearing on May 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.

No Contact with Donald D. or his property.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 09:15 am.

No Contact with Donald D. or his property.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:02 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Donald D. or his property.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:04 a.m.
